citations.narrative:
There was a bin of Mazuri Large Primate biscuits in the feed storage area that expired 10/10/2024. The food fed to
nonhuman primates must be clean, wholesome, and palatable to the animals to maintain a healthy condition, weight
range and prevent potential animal disease. It must be sufficient quantity and have sufficient nutritive value to maintain a
healthful condition and weight range to meet its normal daily nutritional requirements.
Correct by: 02/14/2025

The Turkey Vulture enclosure had platforms with exposed damaged plywood and/or particleboard that was not able to be
effectively cleaned and sanitized. A perch in the Red-Tailed Hawk enclosure was covered in a thick layer of green slime.
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that all surfaces in contact with the birds may be readily
cleaned and/or sanitized in accordance with 3.158 or be replaced when worn or soiled.
Correct by: 03/07/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
3.82(a) 
   
Feeding. 
There was a bin of Mazuri Large Primate biscuits in the feed storage area that expired 10/10/2024. The food fed to 
nonhuman primates must be clean, wholesome, and palatable to the animals to maintain a healthy condition, weight 
range and prevent potential animal disease. It must be sufficient quantity and have sufficient nutritive value to maintain a 
healthful condition and weight range to meet its normal daily nutritional requirements.  
Correct by: 02/14/2025 
3.153(a)(1)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The Turkey Vulture enclosure had platforms with exposed damaged plywood and/or particleboard that was not able to be 
effectively cleaned and sanitized. A perch in the Red-Tailed Hawk enclosure was covered in a thick layer of green slime. 
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that all surfaces in contact with the birds may be readily 
cleaned and/or sanitized in accordance with 3.158 or be replaced when worn or soiled. 
Correct by: 03/07/2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
